page.title: 08TOURISM DARTMOOR
page.content: {Buckland Hall Hotel}is situated down a steep lane and is secluded from the road by trees.The granite building was erected in 1927.The owners run the hotel and employ 3 staff.There are 6 double bedrooms for guests,4 with en suite bathrooms.The carpeted bed rooms have tea and coffee making facilities.The hotel is centrally heated but there are open fires in the lounges and a colour television in one.There are a la carte and table d' hote menus. The grounds extend over 4 acres. In the formal garden a massive square pond is almost covered by lily pads. There are magnificent views across{ {Buckland.}Visitors enjoy walking and riding.They fly fish for salmon,sea trout and brown trout in the {R.Dart.} Bed and breakfast in July is Â£17.50 per person per night.
